kou commented on issue #5853: ARROW-7158: [C++] Use compiler information provided by CMake
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5853#issuecomment-554789779
 
 
   > Do we have any test/job that would exercise this?
   
   I think that most cases are covered by existing CI jobs. But some cases such as `-DARROW_USE_TSAN` aren't covered.
   
   > Is it worth adding one?
   
   It may be better but I don't think that we should add some CI jobs for testing this change. I think that we should add some CI jobs for target functions such as sanitizers. If we don't need some existing features, we should drop code for these features instead of adding new some CI jobs.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [C++][Visual Studio]Build config Error on non English Version visual studio.

comments.body:
We should use {{CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ID}} and {{CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_VERSION}} instead of parsing version string from command line.

* https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/variable/CMAKE_LANG_COMPILER_ID.html#variable:CMAKE_%3CLANG%3E_COMPILER_ID
* https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/variable/CMAKE_LANG_COMPILER_VERSION.html
